title-part.text: APPLIANCES FOR TEACHING, OR COMMUNICATING WITH, THE BLIND, DEAF OR MUTE

reference.text: devices for psychotechnics or for testing reaction times A61B5/16; games, sports, amusements A63; projectors, projector screens G03B

note.note-paragraph:
This subclass covers:
- simulators regarded as teaching or training devices, which
is the case if they give perceptible sensations having a
likeness to the sensations a student would experience in
reality in response to actions taken by him;
- models of buildings, installations, or the like.

This subclass does not cover:
- simulators which demonstrate, by means involving computing,
the function of apparatus or of a system, which are covered
by class G06, if no provision exists elsewhere
- components of simulators, if identical with real devices or
machines, which are covered by the relevant subclasses for
these devices or machines (and not by class G09).

title-part.text: Manually or mechanically operated educational appliances using elements forming, or bearing, symbols, signs, pictures, or the like which are arranged or adapted to be arranged in one or more particular ways

reference.text: puzzle-games A63F9/00; advertising or displaying in general G09F

title-part.text: and having a support carrying or adapted to carry the elements
the elements each bearing a single symbol or a single combination of symbols
and being attachable to, or mounted on, the support
by means of pins and holes
by means of ring-like securing elements

reference.text: sheets temporarily attached together by rings or coils B42F3/00, G09B5/00

title-part.text: the elements being slidably mounted on the support
the elements each bearing a plurality of different symbols, signs, or combinations of symbols and signs, only one symbol, sign, or combination thereof, of each element to be used at a time
and bearing the symbols on a surface parallel to the axis of rotation
and bearing the symbols on a surface perpendicular to the axis of rotation
the elements being in flexible strip form, e.g. endless bands
the elements being arranged in fan form
wherein the elements are adapted to be arranged in co-operation with the support to form symbols
comprising elements to be used without a special support

CPC-specific-text.text: the elements comprising interacting electronic components

title-part.text: the elements to be placed loosely in adjacent relationship
the elements being connectible by corresponding projections and recesses
to form symbols or signs by appropriate arrangement
Manually or mechanically operated teaching appliances working with questions and answers

reference.text: advertising or displaying in general G09F

title-part.text: of the type wherein the student is expected to construct an answer to the question which is presented or wherein the machine gives an answer to the question presented by a student

CPC-specific-text.text: with invisibly printed correct answer; the answer being rendered visible by special optical means, e.g. filters; mirrors

title-part.text: of the multiple-choice answer type, i.e. where a given question is provided with a series of answers and a choice has to be made

reference.text: having one set of answers common to a plurality of questions G09B3/12

CPC-specific-text.text: with invisibly printed correct answer; the answer being rendered visible by special optical means, e.g. filters; mirrors

title-part.text: wherein one set of answers is common to a plurality of questions

reference.text: working with questions and answers G09B7/00; simulators G09B9/00; advertising or displaying in general G09F

note.note-paragraph: Group G09B5/08 takes precedence over groups G09B5/02 to G09B5/06.

with audible presentation of the material to be studied

title-part.text: with both visual and audible presentation of the material to be studied

title-part.text: Combinations of audio and projected visual presentation, e.g. film, slides]
providing for individual presentation of information to a plurality of student stations
all student stations being capable of presenting the same information simultaneously
different stations being capable of presenting different information simultaneously
with provision for individual teacher-student communication

reference.text: mechanically operated G09B3/00; computing arrangements G06F

title-part.text: of the type wherein the student is expected to construct an answer to the question which is presented or wherein the machine gives an answer to the question presented by a student
